page.title: 15ESTATE LAND IN EDAY
page.content: For many years the majority of the land on Eday was owned by one family, the head of which was known locally as "the Laird". This family rented out many of the crofts for a very small amount per annum to the local people. Lately legislation has come into being to ensure that rented land can be bought by crofters for fifteen times their annual rent. Many took up this option and now own the land. Also the laird's family have been willing to sell off hill land at a reasonable price to enable farmers to increase their acreage or allow new farms to come into being. Therefore much of the land on the west side of the island, which was mainly rough heather and peat banks, has now been converted to grazing land.
